meanings.definition: To deliver a sermon or moral lecture.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was sermonizing about the importance of kindness to the students.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys sermonizing at the local church every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The cat was sermonizing to the other animals about the benefits of napping.
meanings.sent4: The wise old tree seemed to be sermonizing to the young saplings about weathering the storms of life.
meanings.sent5: The coach was sermonizing to the team about the value of teamwork and perseverance.

meanings.definition: The act of giving a sermon or moral lecture.
meanings.sent1: His sermonizing at the town hall gathered a large audience.
meanings.sent2: The priest's sermonizing always left a lasting impact on the congregation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's sermonizing on the absurdity of everyday life had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting was a sermonizing on the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The politician's sermonizing on unity resonated with the crowd.
